Location: On Town Rd. About 3 Miles North of De Bruce
Marker text: Collection of Early Crafts Brought Here 1907 By Master Wood Engraver. Meeting Place of \Down Renters\" Or \"The Sheepskin Indians\"
Encampment Ground of 143Rd Regiment, New York Volunteer Infantry Aug. 14 - Oct. 10, 1862
In Monticello Built By John P. Jones Founder of Village December 1804
Monticello, New York Organized In Districts, 1804; Present Church Built 1844
First Church In Monticello Established 1810 Lot Gift of Jones Brothers

Location: At Bridge Near Old Mill, Thompsonville
Marker text: Named For William A Thompson First Judge of Sullivan County Appointed 1803

Location: On NYS 52, Del. R. Bridge. Narowsburg
Marker text: Explored By Dutch, 1609 Settled By Dutch, 1624; Under English Rule After 1664. Named For Duke of York, Later King James II

Location: On NYS 97 Near Old Tusten Church Tusten
Marker text: Named For Lt. Col. Genjamin Tusten of Goshen Militia Surgeon Who Gave His Life To Attend The Wounded At The Battle of Minisink
